result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy M Whitehead was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeremy M Whitehead is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeremy M Whitehead was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Jeremy M Whitehead was found guilty of Possess Firearm on Grounds of a School, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.605(2)(a).
  • Jeremy M Whitehead was found guilty of Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Jeremy M Whitehead was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to count three.    Credit for 156 days.

AS TO COUNT TWO:  Pay the DV surcharge.
AS TO COUNTS TWO, FOUR AND FIVE:  As stated, ordered in count three.

AS TO COUNTS TWO-FIVE:  Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs and surcharges by 11/23/2015.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to count two.
The Court did not address the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: AS TO COUNTS 2-5:  No contact with victim remains.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt: Counts two, four and five.
Count three.

Defendant Jeremy M Whitehead in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Jeremy M Whitehead in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Court grants state's motion to dismiss count 1. Court grants states's motion for judgment on the verdicts.  
AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to 9 months consecutive to count 3 in the HOC with credit for 156 days time served.
AS TO COUNT 3:The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS CONSECUTIVE to count 2, the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR and 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the court did not address the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
AS TO COUNT 4:The Court sentenced the defendant to 9 months in the HOC concurrent to count 3.
AS TO COUNT 5:The Court sentenced the defendant to 9 months in the HOC concurrent to count 3.

AS TO COUNTS 2-5: NO CONTACT WITH VICTIM REMAINS.
Defendant to complete a Batterer's Intervention Program.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs 11.23.15 or be be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means..
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 11.23.15 be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
AS TO COUNT 2: the defendant is to pay the DV surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Defendant Jeremy M Whitehead in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Jeremy M Whitehead in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury contined deliberations at the hour of 8:30 am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Johnson and Spotek who were duly sworn for that purpose.  At the hour of 1:13 pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdicts of GUILTY AS TO COUNTS 2-5 which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court holds state's motion for judgment on the verdicts and holds defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict for a ruling at sentencing.  Court stays Miranda issue until sentencing. Defendant is remanded and all other conditions of bail remain.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-23-2015 at 08:30 am.

Closing arguments by the state and defense. Alternate juror selected by lot and released. Jury retired at the hour of 3:14 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Johnson and Takerian who were duly sworn for that purpose.
Sworn for the state: Roy Horn MPD Officer. Exhibits 12a-14 received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Sworn for defense: Jeremy Whitehead.  State and defense rest.

Sworn for the state: James Jackson MPD Officer, Troy Jankowski MPD Detective, Brad Buddenhagen MPD Sgt. Exhibits 7, 4 received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury in the box.  Sworn for defense: Jeremy Whitehead. Court instructed jury.
Sworn for the state:  Shameecha H. Exhibits  3-6 received.
Sworn for the state:  Keith C., Gabrielle H.B., Mulunda H.B., Exhibits  1-2 received.

Jury panel in court.  Voir dire continued.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.

Defendant Jeremy M Whitehead in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Jeremy M Whitehead in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel waived reading of the of the Amenede Information and entered a plea of not guilty as to Count 1 (re-enters not guilty plea as to counts 2-3) on behalf of defendant.
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  3:54 pm.

Case set for preliminary hearing. Due to Court calendar congestions case spun to Preliminary Court. Case sent forthwith.

Defendant Jeremy M Whitehead in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Jeremy M Whitehead in custody.  Ronald Dague for Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Troy Jankowski-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Shamecka H. or her residence; Mulunda J. or Franklin Pierce Middle School at 2765 N Fratney Street

Defendant Jeremy M Whitehead in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Jeremy M Whitehead in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 2, 4, &5.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
